musicalLanguage.description: An adaptation of the legendary guitar fingerpicking intro for piano. The original features a chromatic descending bass line under arpeggiated chords, creating one of the most recognizable openings in rock history. This piano arrangement preserves the descending bass motion and the delicate arpeggiated texture.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro (8 bars) — Am descending bass line: A-G#-G-F#-F-E with arpeggiated chords above
keyMoments: Bars 1-4: The chromatic descent from A to F — each bass note drops a half step while the upper voices sustain
Bars 5-6: The arrival at F major and the mood shift
Bars 7-8: G to Am resolution — the descent completes its cycle
teachingGoals: Chromatic bass line movement — half-step descents
Arpeggiated patterns adapted from guitar fingerpicking
Independent voice control — bass moves while upper notes sustain
styleTips: Play delicately — this is fingerpicking, not strumming
The bass line descent should be smooth and connected, like a slow walk downstairs
Let the upper notes ring while the bass moves — use pedal carefully

measures.rightHand: E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: Am — the iconic opening. The right hand arpeggiates while the bass begins its chromatic descent.

measures.rightHand: E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e E4:e B4:e C5:e B4:e
measures.teachingNote: The bass continues descending G-F# while the arpeggiation pattern subtly varies.

measures.rightHand: E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: F to E — the bass descent continues. We are moving through the chromatic scale step by step.

measures.rightHand: E4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e E4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: E minor arpeggiation — the harmony opens up as the bass reaches D. A moment of clarity.

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e F4:e C4:e F4:e A4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: F major — a warm, bright contrast after the chromatic descent. The mood shifts.

measures.rightHand: D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e D4:e G4:e B4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: G major — building energy. The arpeggio pattern is becoming natural now.

measures.rightHand: E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e E4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e
measures.teachingNote: Back to Am — the cycle returns home. The descent was a journey, and here we arrive.
A minor settles — the arpeggio slows to a held E. The intro is complete.
